    • Constructor Detail

      • Copy

        public Copy(Resource resource,
            int copyID,
            User borrower,
            int loanDuration,
            java.util.Date borrowDate,
            java.util.Date lastRenewal,
            java.util.Date dueDate)
        Makes a new copy with the given arguments as data.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource this copy belongs to.
        copyID - The ID of the new copy.
        borrower - The user borrowing the copy currently.
        loanDuration - The duration in days that a loan is valid, untill it is renewed or until the user needs to bring it back.
        borrowDate - Date copy was borrowed.
        lastRenewal - Last date the loan was renewed.
        dueDate - Date by which this copy needs to be returned.

      • Copy

        public Copy(Resource resource,
            int copyID,
            User borrower,
            int loanDuration)
        Makes a new copy with the given arguments as data. The dates are initialised as null.
        Parameters:
        resource - The resource this copy belongs to.
        copyID - The ID of the new copy.
        borrower - The user borrowing the copy currently.
        loanDuration - The duration in days that a loan is valid, until it is renewed or until the user needs to bring it back.

        public void setLoanDuration(int duration)
        Set loan duration variable and updates it in database.

      • getDueDate

        public java.util.Date getDueDate()
        Gets the due date variable.
        Returns:
        due date by which the copy needs to be brought back.

      • setDueDate

        public void setDueDate()
        Sets the due date according to the specification, such that it is tomorrow or the earliest date at which the borrower has had this copy for the entire loan duration.

      • checkRenewal

        public boolean checkRenewal()
        Boolean method that checks if the renewal date is before current date, and returns true if it is otherwise returns false, and sets the renewal date forward in time by the loan duration.
        Returns:
        true if renewal date is before todays date otherwise returns false.

      • getBorrowDate

        public java.util.Date getBorrowDate()
        Get method for borrow date variable.
        Returns:
        The date this copy was borrowed.

      • setBorrowDate

        public void setBorrowDate(java.util.Date borrowDate)
        Sets borrow date variable and updates the database.
        Parameters:
        borrowDate - Date the copy was borrowed.

      • getBorrower

        public User getBorrower()
        Gets the borrower variable.
        Returns:
        The user that borrows this copy.

      • isBorrowed

        public boolean isBorrowed()
        Boolean method that checks if a copy is borrowed.
        Returns:
        true is borrower is not null, false if it is null.

      • getLastRenewal

        public java.util.Date getLastRenewal()
        Gets the last renewal date.
        Returns:
        Last date the loan was renewed.

      • resetDates

        public void resetDates()
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method that resets all date variables if there is no borrower of a copy. If it is currently borrowed, it throws an exception.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the copy is still borrowed.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this copy suitable to display to any user browsing the library. For this reason, it only says the copy ID and whether it is available or not and leaves the rest of the information, which should not be publicly accessible.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Shortened representation of this copy suitable for public viewing.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Copy otherCopy)
        Compares a copy date with another copy of that resource based on their due date.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Copy>
        Parameters:
        otherCopy - The other copy being compared to this one.
        Returns:
        -1 if it is before another copy's due date, 1 if its after a another copy's due date, otherwise return 0.

      • getBorrowerIDSafely

        public java.lang.String getBorrowerIDSafely()
        Gets the borrower but returns null if there isn't a borrower.
        Returns:
        null if there is no borrower, borrowers username if there is a borrower.
